Package ausroulette.model

Class GameEngineImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ausroulette.model.GameEngineImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameEngine, GameCallbackCollection
    public class GameEngineImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameEngine
    A concrete representation of a game engine in the Aussie Roulette game in the Further Programming Assignment.

    This implements the interface GameEngine.

    This is the main class of the game. It relies on all the supporting classes to be able to correctly function.

    Author:
    YOU!
    See Also:
    GameEngine, GameCallbackCollection, GameCallback, Player, Bet, Wheel

                        java.lang.String name,

        GameCallback.playerAdded(Player) is invoked on all registered callbacks once the player is successfully added.

        name - the name of the player

      • removePlayer

        public Player removePlayer​(java.lang.String id)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        Removed a registered player with the matching id from the game.

        Players can only be removed when they do not have any current bets.

        GameCallback.playerRemoved(Player) is invoked on all registered callbacks once the player is successfully removed.

        Specified by:
        removePlayer in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the player to remove
        Returns:
        the player that was removed

      • placeColorBet

        public Bet placeColorBet​(java.lang.String id,
                         int amount,
                         PocketColor color)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        Places a color bet using the supplied information.

        Any existing color bet for the same player and color should be combined into a single bet with the combined amounts and replace the existing bet.

        GameCallback.betAccepted(Player, Bet, Bet) is invoked on all registered callbacks once the bet is successfully placed.

        Note: PocketColor.GREEN is not valid for ColorBet. If PocketColor.GREEN is supplied a BetType.ZERO NumberBet should be created.

        Specified by:
        placeColorBet in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the player
        amount - the amount of points to bet
        color - the PocketColor to bet on
        Returns:
        the created bet

        Specified by:
        placeNumberBet in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the player
        amount - the amount of points to bet
        number - the Pocket number to bet on

      • placeSplitBet2

        public Bet placeSplitBet2​(java.lang.String id,
                          int amount,
                          int baseNumber)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        Places a 2-way split bet using the supplied information.

        Any existing split bet for the same player and numbers should be combined into a single bet with the combined amounts and replace the existing bet.

        GameCallback.betAccepted(Player, Bet, Bet) is invoked on all registered callbacks once the bet is successfully placed.

        This method infers the second number in the 2-way split is one higher than the supplied base number.

        Specified by:
        placeSplitBet2 in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the player
        amount - the amount of points to bet
        baseNumber - the first Pocket number to create a split bet with
        Returns:
        the created bet

      • placeSplitBet4

        public Bet placeSplitBet4​(java.lang.String id,
                          int amount,
                          int baseNumber)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        Places a 4-way split bet using the supplied information.

        Any existing split bet for the same player and numbers should be combined into a single bet with the combined amounts and replace the existing bet.

        GameCallback.betAccepted(Player, Bet, Bet) is invoked on all registered callbacks once the bet is successfully placed.

        This method infers the other numbers in the 4-way split based than the supplied base number, which is assumed to be the lowest number.

        Specified by:
        placeSplitBet4 in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the player
        amount - the amount of points to bet
        baseNumber - the first Pocket number to create a split bet with
        Returns:
        the created bet

                          int number4)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        Places a 4-way split bet using the supplied information.

        Any existing split bet for the same player and numbers should be combined into a single bet with the combined amounts and replace the existing bet.

        GameCallback.betAccepted(Player, Bet, Bet) is invoked on all registered callbacks once the bet is successfully placed.

        Specified by:
        placeSplitBet4 in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the player
        amount - the amount of points to bet
        number1 - the first Pocket number to create a split bet with
        number2 - the second Pocket number to create a split bet with
        number3 - the third Pocket number to create a split bet with
        number4 - the forth (last) Pocket number to create a split bet with
        Returns:
        the created bet

      • spinToWin

        public Pocket spinToWin​(int ticks,
                        int delay)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        Spin method. Bets are finalised when invoking this method.

        This method can be used for testing as the outcome is predetermined.

        This method must do the following:

        • move the wheel to the random starting pocket number
        • invoke the GameCallback.spinStart(int, Pocket) method to notify all registered callbacks of the spin number and starting pocket
        • Tick over the wheel to the next pocket the supplied number of ticks times
        • for each tick invoke the GameCallback.spinTick(int, int, Pocket) method to notify all registered callback or the spin number, the tick number and the current wheel pocket, except on the last tick three GameCallback.spinResult(int, Pocket) is used instead
        • between each tick (including after the starting tick and before the return tick) a delay should be performed using the time (ms) specified by the delay parameter
        • the wheel must to at least one complete revolution
        • finalise the bets by calling GameEngine.applyWinLoss(int, Pocket)
        Specified by:
        spinToWin in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        ticks - the number of ticks of the wheel
        delay - the delay in ms between each tick
        Returns:
        the winning (final/result) pocket

      • spinToWin

        public Pocket spinToWin​(int ticks,
                        int delay,
                        int startingNumber)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        Spin method. Bets are finalised when invoking this method.

        This method can be used for testing as the outcome is predetermined.

        This method must do the following:

        • move the wheel to the supplied starting pocket number
        • invoke the GameCallback.spinStart(int, Pocket) method to notify all registered callbacks of the spin number and starting pocket
        • Tick over the wheel to the next pocket the supplied number of ticks times
        • for each tick invoke the GameCallback.spinTick(int, int, Pocket) method to notify all registered callback or the spin number, the tick number and the current wheel pocket, except on the last tick three GameCallback.spinResult(int, Pocket) is used instead
        • between each tick (including after the starting tick and before the return tick) a delay should be performed using the time (ms) specified by the delay parameter
        • finalise the bets by calling GameEngine.applyWinLoss(int, Pocket)
        Specified by:
        spinToWin in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        ticks - the number of ticks of the wheel
        delay - the delay in ms between each tick
        startingNumber - the pocket number to start the spin on
        Returns:
        the winning (final/result) pocket

      • spin

        public Pocket spin​(int ticks,
                   int delay,
                   int startingNumber)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        Basic spin method. No bets are finalised when invoking this method.

        This method is designed for testing and to potentially be used in the final GUI for spinning the wheel without needing a result.

        This method must do the following:

        • move the wheel to the supplied starting pocket number
        • invoke the GameCallback.spinStart(int, Pocket) method to notify all registered callbacks of the spin number and starting pocket
        • Tick over the wheel to the next pocket the supplied number of ticks times
        • for each tick invoke the GameCallback.spinTick(int, int, Pocket) method to notify all registered callback or the spin number, the tick number and the current wheel pocket, except on the last tick three GameCallback.spinResult(int, Pocket) is used instead
        • between each tick (including after the starting tick and before the return tick) a delay should be performed using the time (ms) specified by the delay parameter
        Specified by:
        spin in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        ticks - the number of ticks of the wheel
        delay - the delay in ms between each tick
        startingNumber - the pocket number to start the spin on
        Returns:
        the winning (final/result) pocket

      • applyWinLoss

        public void applyWinLoss​(int spinNumber,
                         Pocket winningPocket)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        This method finalises bets after a spin and is mainly separated from the spin methods for cohesion, debugging and testing purposes.

        For each registered player this method should

        • finalise each of the players bets
        • invoke GameCallback.betResult(int, Player, Bet) for each registered callback, notifying them of each of the finalised bets
        • reset the players bets - they can be removed once finalised
        • calculate the amount (if any) the player one on the spin
        • invoke GameCallback.spinPlayerTotal(int, Player, Collection, int, int) passing this information and the collections of bets to the registered callbacks
        The method should also calculate the total player wins and losses and pass this information to all the registered callbacks by invoking GameCallback.spinHouseResult(int, int, int)
        Specified by:
        applyWinLoss in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        spinNumber - the spin number - a counter for the times the wheel has been spun
        winningPocket - the winning (final / result) pocket at the conclusion of the spin for which these bets are being finalised
